item.title: Installing Apache 2.0.59 to a Windows-based computer, locally: Part 1
item.description: In this multi-part guide, we'll be porting over from an Apache 1.3.x Web server to an Apache 2.0.x Web server. We'll also be going over how to add Perl support, and in later guides, how to setup both PHP 4 and 5, ColdFusion MX 6.1 and 7, as well as MySQL and PostgreSQL.

item.title: Upgrading (our local install of) ActivePerl
item.description: In a previous guide, we walked through installing ActivePerl on a local machine. This time, we'll be upgrading ActivePerl. For this guide, we'll be upgrading from ActivePerl 5.8.7.815 to 5.8.8.817. Note that this guide can also be used in the upgrade to, or installation of, ActivePerl 5.8.8.819.

item.title: Installing Perl on a local Windows-based, Apache, server
item.description: Now that we've added Apache, configured our log files, and setup a log file analysis tool, it's time to install Perl. Perl will allow us to expand our horizons, and specifically will help us install a better log analyzer.
